intro: Spergularia dillenii, commonly known as the sea sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that thrives in coastal environments, particularly in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer, and its leaves are typically narrow and succulent. Spergularia dillenii is well adapted to salt spray and can tolerate harsh maritime conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and is often found in the intertidal zones of the Atlantic coast.
